diseases.method: Prepare henna paste and apply to the scalp; leave ~20-30 minutes then rinse.
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet (Ibn al-Qayyim). Also found in Tib-e-Nabvi.
diseases.remedy_description: Henna is a fine greenish-brown powder made from dried leaves of the Lawsonia inermis plant. It has a faint earthy scent and, when mixed into a paste, forms a reddish-brown dye used topically. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Henna

diseases.remedy: Aromatic inhalations (e.g., narcissus scent) and rest
diseases.method: Smell narcissus or other aromatic plants; rest in a dark, quiet place
diseases.dose: Inhale as needed; no strict quantity given in text
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet (Narcissus entry)
diseases.remedy_description: Aromatic flowers like Narcissus are fragrant bulbs with showy petals and a central trumpet; they have a sweet floral smell and are used for inhalation therapies. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Narcissus

diseases.remedy: Powdered Indian aloe (Qust) mixed with alum and myrrh seeds as sniffing powder
diseases.method: Grind to fine powder, moisten lightly and dry. Dissolve or moisten when needed and sniff while lying on back with head extended.
diseases.timing: When congestion/uvula symptoms present; repeat until improvement
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet â€” sniff remedies for throat/uvula
diseases.remedy_description: Indian costus (Qust or Saussurea costus) is a brown woody aromatic root used medicinally; it is fibrous, earthy-bitter in taste and often powdered for inhalation. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Costus
